fact_check_explanation_title: A post about coronavirus vaccines gets facts about their safety, ingredients, and legality wrong
fact_check_explanation_summary: Many of the claims in this post are common myths about the vaccine.

fact_check_explanation_title: Putting outsourced contact tracing spend in context
fact_check_explanation_summary: Spend on contact tracing is a small part of Test and Trace. As of October, roughly the same amount had been spent on national and local authority tracing efforts.
Sir Keir Starmer and other Labour MPs claim that people are breaking the rules because they cannot afford to follow them, but this is not what the evidence says

fact_check_explanation_title: Cambridge Covid-19 test results don’t mean PCR tests are inaccurate
fact_check_explanation_summary: A higher ratio of false positives to true positives are expected when viral prevalence in the community drops.

fact_check_explanation_title: False claims about first vaccine recipients spread on social media
fact_check_explanation_summary: Posts claim that CNN used a picture of one of the first vaccine recipients back in October. They did not.

fact_check_explanation_title: Claims about the Pfizer Covid-19 vaccine ingredients lack evidence
fact_check_explanation_summary: Claims about PEG, non-neutralizing antibodies, fertility and late effects have been made about the first Covid-19 vaccine approved in the UK.

fact_check_explanation_title: School funding hasn’t increased by £5k per pupil
fact_check_explanation_summary: The Conservative Party has made incorrect claims about education spending on social media.

fact_check_explanation_title: No evidence Pfizer Covid-19 vaccine affects women’s fertility
fact_check_explanation_summary: The vaccine causes an immune response to a spike protein, but this almost certainly won’t make the body attack the placenta.

fact_check_explanation_title: The new vaccination card is not a ‘Covid passport’
fact_check_explanation_summary: It is a vaccine record card with appointment details, but no secure identifying information

fact_check_explanation_title: Vaccine approval isn’t quicker because of Brexit
fact_check_explanation_summary: The MHRA could have given the Pfizer vaccine the same emergency approval when the UK was in the EU.

fact_check_explanation_title: Telegraph wrong on Whitty and Vallance statements
fact_check_explanation_summary: Allison Pearson claimed Chris Whitty and Patrick Vallance cherry-picked rising hospital bed occupancy figures in the coronavirus briefing last week. They didn’t.

fact_check_explanation_title: Mersey Care has only had five Covid-19 deaths because it is not an acute trust
fact_check_explanation_summary: This is the second time we’ve seen FOI requests on Covid-19 deaths sent to trusts who are unlikely to deal with seriously ill coronavirus patients.
